medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began experiencing pain in the right lower quadrant of her abdomen three days prior to admission. The pain intensified the following day, accompanied by very frequent, watery stools transitioning from brown to black, nausea, and a peak temperature of 38.3°C. Symptoms worsened before admission, including severe pain unrelieved by acetaminophen–oxycodone, although diarrhea ceased on the day of admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had undergone a cesarean section three weeks prior to admission due to multiple bouts of fetal bradycardia. The pregnancy was otherwise uneventful, and the postpartum course was normal.
